value.title: How the coronavirus is turbocharging Hong Kong’s fintech revolution
value.excerpt: Forced to adapt quickly, Hong Kong’s banking and financial services industry has hastened its adoption of digital transformation and AI in the name of survival, supported by a rapidly evolving regulatory environment.

value.title: How AI Researchers Are Tackling Transparent AI: Interview With Steve Eglash, Stanford University
value.excerpt: One of the often cited challenges with AI is the inability to get well-understood explanations of how the AI systems are making decisions.

value.title: AI teammates are finally coming to Ghost Recon Breakpoint on July 15
value.excerpt: Ubisoft today announced that the highly requested AI teammates feature is finally coming to its cooperative tactical title Ghost Recon Wildlands, letting solo players gain help from three AI Ghosts.

value.title: 2 Healthcare IPOs Getting a Tailwind From COVID-19 to Consider Buying
value.excerpt: If you're considering investing in one or more recent initial public offerings in the healthcare sector, you've got many options. Over the last year, 76 healthcare companies have gone public, according to finviz.

value.title: Dairies to housekeeping, robots find their way into new spaces
value.excerpt: They rely on tracks or magnetic strips to cover fixed routes. But mobile robots are becoming more autonomous, with a push from advances in computer vision and artificial intelligence. We read about self-driving cars and driverless delivery vans.

value.title: Op-ed: Hyperwar is coming. America needs to bring AI into the fight to win — with caution
value.excerpt: Superpower standoffs like those between the U.S. and China in the South China Sea are occurring amid the rise of artificial intelligence. AI will speed up military decision-making, but it is risky.

value.title: AI + IoT = 1000X More Dense Networking Environments: How Intel, NSF Are Planning For Tomorrow
value.excerpt: How will we connect everything at such scale? Intel and the National Science Foundation say we’ll need help from artificial intelligence. And mesh networks. Including, potentially, even SpaceX Starlink satellites in low earth orbit.

value.title: Zapata CEO Christopher Savoie: The QC and ML business use case is ‘a when, not an if’
value.excerpt: Zapata CEO Christopher Savoie explains the quantum computing and machine learning business use case: "It's just a matter of timing that nobody knows."

value.title: The enormous opportunity in fintech
value.excerpt: Several areas of the fintech ecosystem are often overlooked but present massive opportunities for disruptors over the next 5 years.

value.title: How Remote Work Can Fuel The New AI Tech Centers
value.excerpt: Work from home has become the new standard for several jobs worldwide. It is re-architecting how companies organize their workforce. It may also drive the creation of a new hub-and-spoke model for cities.

value.title: DeepMind researchers propose rebuilding the AI industry on a base of anticolonialism
value.excerpt: DeepMind researchers argue that anticolonial theory should be part of the AI development process to avoid perpetuating algorithmic oppression.

value.title: How To Flunk Those Cognitive Deficiency Tests And What This Means Too For AI Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: This is especially being widely noted by some prominent politicians that appear to be attempting to vouch for having mental clarity upon reaching an age in life whereby cognitive decline often surfaces.

value.title: Six deep learning applications ready for the enterprise mainstream
value.excerpt: Deep learning, used to classify images, recognize voices and analyze video images, is emerging as the next big wave of artificial intelligence.

value.title: Announcing the second annual VentureBeat AI Innovation Awards at Transform 2020
value.excerpt: VentureBeat's AI Innovation Awards are back at Transform 2020, where we'll recognize and award emergent, compelling, and influential work in AI.

value.title: Prepare for Artificial Intelligence to Produce Less Wizardry
value.excerpt: A new paper argues that the computing demands of deep learning are so great that progress on tasks like translation and self-driving is likely to slow.

value.title: The path to real-world artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Experts from MIT and IBM held a webinar this week to discuss where AI technologies are today and advances that will help make their usage more practical and widespread.

value.title: White House advisory council calls on U.S. to increase AI funding to $10 billion by 2030
value.excerpt: PCAST, an advisory council within the U.S. Office of Science and Technology, recommends increasing government investment in AI research.

value.title: AI Weekly: Welcome to The Machine, VentureBeat’s AI site
value.excerpt: VentureBeat reorganized its site and branding to better faciliate the distinct communities it's cultivated around AI and gaming. Meet "The Machine."

value.title: Foxconn launches iAI Institute aimed to train people in industrial artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Foxconn launched the iAI Institute “an initiative focused on training the workforce of tomorrow and sharing Industrial AI knowledge across industries.”  The iAI Institute plans to help train people in industrial artificial intelligence.

value.title: The best way for companies to incorporate ESG goals is by using data science and AI
value.excerpt: Junta Nakai, global industry leader for financial services at Databricks, explains why using tech is the key to truly realizing the benefits of ESG.

value.title: Facebook’s AI separates speech in recordings of up to 5 people
value.excerpt: Facebook researchers describe an AI system that can isolate speech from recordings of multiple speakers on a single microphone.

value.title: Tools for language access during COVID-19
value.excerpt: Translation services make it easier to communicate with someone who doesn’t speak the same language, whether you’re traveling abroad or living in a new country. value.title: Societal upheaval during the COVID-19 pandemic underscores need for new AI data regulations
value.excerpt: How should society address the scenario where the AI algorithm got it right but from an ethical standpoint, we're uncomfortable with the results?

value.title: Aryballe raises $7.9 million for odor-detecting AI sensors
value.excerpt: Aryballe, which develops AI-powered products capable of detecting and analyzing scents, has raised $7.9 million in venture capital.

value.title: AI 50 Founders Predict What Artificial Intelligence Will Look Like After Covid-19

value.title: Data privacy concerns weigh heavily on China’s AI leadership ambitions amid US trade sanctions
value.excerpt: Chinese organisations are expected to strike a delicate balancing act to advance artificial intelligence development, while ensuring the technology’s ethical application amid recent US trade sanctions.
